title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.001
frontText: What are the three key objectives of information security?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.002
frontText: Risk exists at the intersection of _______ and _________.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.003
frontText: What is the overall risk rating for a risk that has medium likelihood and high impact?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.004
frontText: What type of system controls access to a network based on criteria such as time of day, location, device type, and system health?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.005
frontText: What are the three networks typically connected to a triple‐homed firewall?
backText: The Internet, an internal network, and a screened subnet (DMZ)

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.006
frontText: What is the TCP port for the HTTP protocol?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.007
frontText: What is the TCP port for the HTTPS protocol?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.008
frontText: What are the four types of firewalls?
backText: Packet filters, stateful inspection firewalls, next‐generation firewalls, and web application firewalls

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.009
frontText: ______ may be used to apply settings to many different Windows systems at the same time.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.010
frontText: What are the four phases of penetration testing?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.011
frontText: What type of software can you use to enumerate the services that are accepting network connections on a remote system without probing that system for vulnerabilities?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.012
frontText: What is the range of well‐known ports?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.013
frontText: What is the range of registered ports?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.014
frontText: What is the most commonly used port scanner?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.015
frontText: What service is responsible for resolving domain names to IP addresses?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.016
frontText: What service allows you to look up the registered owner of a domain name?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.017
frontText: What type of data analysis looks for differences from expected behaviors?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.018
frontText: What type of data analysis predicts threats based on existing data?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.019
frontText: What regulation requires vulnerability scans for organizations involved in credit card processing?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.020
frontText: What regulation requires vulnerability scanning for federal government agencies?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.021
frontText: What type of vulnerability scan leverages read‐only access to the scan target?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.022
frontText: What term is used to describe an organization’s willingness to tolerate risk?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.023
frontText: What type of account should be used to perform credentialed vulnerability scans?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.024
frontText: What function is performed by Nessus and OpenVAS?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.025
frontText: What is the purpose of Nikto and Arachni?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.026
frontText: What criteria should be used in prioritizing the remediation of vulnerabilities?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.027
frontText: What industry‐standard system is used to assess the severity of security vulnerabilities?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.028
frontText: What are the CVSS score ranges?
backText: Under CVSS version 3.1, 0.1–3.9 is low, 4.0–6.9 is medium, 7.0–8.9 is high, and 9.0–10.0 is critical.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.029
frontText: What is the term used to describe when a scanner reports a vulnerability that does not really exist?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.030
frontText: What type of vulnerability allows an attacker to place more data into an area of memory than is allocated for a specific purpose?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.031
frontText: What type of attack seeks to increase the level of access that an attacker has to a targeted system?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.032
frontText: What type of attack allows an attacker to run software of their choice on the targeted system?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.033
frontText: What is the current secure standard for providing HTTPS encryption?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.034
frontText: In what type of attack does the attacker sends massive amounts of traffic from many different spoofed sources to a single target address?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.035
frontText: What term is used to describe any observable occurrence in a system or network that relates to a security function?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.036
frontText: What term is used to describe a violation or imminent threat of violation of computer security policies, acceptable use policies, or standard security practices?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.037
frontText: What are the phases of incident response?
backText: Preparation; Detection & Analysis; Containment, Eradication, & Recovery; and Post‐Incident Activity

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.038
frontText: What type of documents provide the detailed, tactical information that CSIRT members need when responding to an incident?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.039
frontText: What document serves as the cornerstone of an organization’s incident response program?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.040
frontText: What type of threat consists of highly skilled and talented attackers focused on a specific objective?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.041
frontText: What are the types of impact used to describe the scope of a security incident?
backText: Functional impact, economic impact, and recoverability effort

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.042
frontText: What are the common attack vectors for security incidents?
backText: Common attack vectors for security incidents include external/removable media, attrition, the web, email, impersonation, improper usage, loss or theft of equipment, and other/unknown sources.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.043
frontText: What term is used to describe traffic sent to a command and control system by a PC that is part of a botnet?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.044
frontText: What Windows tools provide information on memory, CPU, and disk use?
backText: Perfmon, Resource Monitor, and Task Manager

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.045
frontText: What protocol is used to gather information about and manage network devices?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.046
frontText: What type of information is found in network flow data?
backText: Flow data provides information about the source and destination IP address, protocol, and total data sent.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.047
frontText: What protocol is used to ensure that all security devices on a network have synchronized clocks?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.048
frontText: What is the purpose of FTK, EnCase, SIFT, and the Sleuth Kit (TSK)?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.049
frontText: What type of device is designed to copy drives for forensic investigation, and then provide validation that the original drive and the content of the new drive match?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.050
frontText: Where can forensic analysts turn to find information about logins, service start/stop events, and evidence of applications being run on a Windows system?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.051
frontText: What Linux utility is commonly used to clone drives in RAW format?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.052
frontText: What type of device can ensure that attaching a drive to a forensic copy device or workstation does not result in modifications being made to drive, thus destroying the forensic integrity of the process?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.053
frontText: What is the first action that incident responders should take after identifying a potential incident?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.054
frontText: Network segmentation, isolation, and removal of affected systems are examples of ___________ strategies.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.055
frontText: Once responders have contained the damage caused by an incident, they should move on to __________ and ________ steps.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.056
frontText: At the conclusion of a cybersecurity incident response effort, CSIRT members should conduct a formal ____________ session.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.057
frontText: What activities should always occur to validate an incident recovery effort?
backText: Verify user accounts, verify permissions, verify logging, and conduct vulnerability scans

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.058
frontText: What are the three options available for the secure disposition of media containing sensitive information?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.059
frontText: What is the focus of the recovery phase of incident response?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.060
frontText: ____________ is a time‐consuming investigative task that often distracts incident responders and results in dead ends.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.061
frontText: ________ are high‐level statements of management intent.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.062
frontText: _______ outline what information the organization will maintain and the length of time different categories of information will be retained prior to destruction.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.063
frontText: ________ provide mandatory requirements describing how an organization will carry out its information security policies.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.064
frontText: __________ are detailed, step‐by‐step processes that individuals and organizations must follow in specific circumstances.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.065
frontText: _________ provide best practices and recommendations related to a given concept, technology, or task.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.066
frontText: Many exception processes require the use of ___________________ to mitigate the risk associated with exceptions to security standards.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.067
frontText: What type of controls include firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, network segmentation, and authentication and authorization systems?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.068
frontText: What type of controls involve processes and procedures like those found in incident response plans, account creation and management, as well as awareness and training efforts?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.069
frontText: What type of controls include locks, fences, and other controls that control or limit physical access, as well as controls like fire extinguishers that can help to prevent harm to property?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.070
frontText: _____________ are intended to stop an incident from occurring by taking proactive measures to stop the threat.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.071
frontText: A _______ is often used when services or systems need to be exposed to lower trust areas.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.072
frontText: __________ is the steady accrual of additional rights over time as account owners change roles, positions, or responsibilities.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.073
frontText: What are the stages of the software development life cycle?
backText: Planning, Requirements, Design, Development, Testing, Training and Transition, Ongoing Operations and Maintenance, End‐of‐Life Decommissioning

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.074
frontText: The _______ phase of the SDLC includes actual coding of the application.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.075
frontText: What are the three types of system environments commonly used in organizations?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.076
frontText: In the _______ software development model, each phase follows sequentially and phases do not overlap.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.077
frontText: The _______ software development model is an iterative and incremental process.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.078
frontText: During the _______ phase of software development, security practitioners may be asked to participate in initial assessments or cost evaluations.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.079
frontText: ____________ uses different techniques to allow developers to assess each others’ code before release.

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.080
frontText: What testing technique involves sending invalid or random data to an application to test its ability to handle unexpected data?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.081
frontText: What elements are commonly found in a vulnerability management report?
backText: Vulnerabilities, affected hosts, risk score, mitigation options, recurrence, and prioritization information

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.082
frontText: What are the categories of stakeholders who should receive a vulnerability report?
backText:
1. Technical stakeholders
  2. Security, audit, and compliance stakeholders
  3. Security management and oversight systems
  4. Executive or leadership staff

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.083
frontText: What is used to describe specific metrics like time to remediate or patch, and are set by an organization or are defined as part of a service level agreement with a vendor or service?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.084
frontText: What are some common inhibitors to vulnerability remediation?
backText: Memorandums of understanding, service‐level agreements, organizational governance, business process interruption, degrading functionality, legacy systems, and proprietary systems

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.085
frontText: What NIST reference describes an incident handling process?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.086
frontText: What type of incident analysis uses a principle‐based, systems approach for the identification of underlying causes associated with a particular set of risks?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.087
frontText: What incident response metric measures how long it took from the initial event that resulted in an incident to when it was detected?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.088
frontText: What incident response metric measures the time from detection to assessing the event as an incident and activating the process?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.089
frontText: What incident response metric identifies the time required to resolve a problem?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.090
frontText: What are the common elements of an incident response report?
backText: Executive summary, narrative, recommendations, timeline, impact assessment, scope, and evidence

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.091
frontText: What technology provides an alternative to virtualizing an entire system, and instead permits applications to be run in their own environment with their own required components?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.092
frontText: Name three common system hardening practices.
backText:
Updating and patching the system
Removing unnecessary software and services
Restricting and logging administrative access
Controlling the creation of new accounts
Enabling logging and using appropriate monitoring
Using capabilities like disk encryption and secure boot

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.093
frontText: What Windows Registry key contains system information including scheduled tasks and services?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.094
frontText: What Windows Registry key contains information about the currently logged‐in user?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.095
frontText: What is the core system process on a Windows system called?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.096
frontText: What switch technology provides for logical network segmentation?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.097
frontText: What concept removes the trust that used to be placed in systems, services, and individuals inside security boundaries?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.098
frontText: What are the three major factors used in multifactor authentication?
backText: Something you know, something you have, and something you are

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.099
frontText: What authorization technology allows users to share elements of their identity or account information while authenticating via the original identity provide?

title: fc182909.CySAplSG3E.100
frontText: What are the three main roles in a federated identity management system?
